description: From fr. finicking, from finical, from fine + -ical. Compare dated finikin. Perhaps suggested by Middle Dutch fijnkens 'accurately, neatly, prettily'.

adjectives.description: finicky (comparative finickier or more finicky, superlative finickiest or most finicky)

entries.meaning: (informal, of a person) Fastidious and fussy; difficult to please; exacting, especially about details.
examples: Synonyms: fastidious, fussy; see also Thesaurus:fastidious
My editor is very finicky about punctuation. Every dot and comma has to be just right.
She has a finicky baby that's hard to feed.
The lawnmower is a bit finicky in cold weather.
